Package tk.shardsoftware.util

Class PerlinNoiseGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • tk.shardsoftware.util.PerlinNoiseGenerator
  • public class PerlinNoiseGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
    Based on the Perlin Noise algorithm by Ken Perlin, specifically the method described here: https://adrianb.io/2014/08/09/perlinnoise.html
    You can view the original algorithm as described by Perlin here: https://mrl.cs.nyu.edu/~perlin/paper445.pdf
    Author:
    Hector Woods

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      float amplitude
      Amplitude of our noise function, i.e how "tall" it is
      float frequency
      The frequency of our noise function, i.e how often we reach a peak
      float lacunarity
      The frequency is adjusted by this value for each octave
      int octaves
      The number of 'layers' per sample, combined to make the overall noise function.
      private int[] permutationTable  
      float persistence
      The amplitude is adjusted by this value for each octave, i.e the higher persistence is the more effect each nth octave has
      float scale
      How 'zoomed-in' our noise is.

    • Field Detail

      • octaves

        public int octaves
        The number of 'layers' per sample, combined to make the overall noise function.

      • amplitude

        public float amplitude
        Amplitude of our noise function, i.e how "tall" it is

      • frequency

        public float frequency
        The frequency of our noise function, i.e how often we reach a peak

      • lacunarity

        public float lacunarity
        The frequency is adjusted by this value for each octave

      • persistence

        public float persistence
        The amplitude is adjusted by this value for each octave, i.e the higher persistence is the more effect each nth octave has

      • scale

        public float scale
        How 'zoomed-in' our noise is. The higher the value, the more zoomed in we are.

      • permutationTable

        private int[] permutationTable

    • Method Detail

      • getGradient

        private com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 getGradient​(int permutation)
        One of four gradients as described in "Improving perlin noise"
        Parameters:
        permutation - the permutation
        Returns:
        One of four diagonal directional vectors

      • setUpPermutationTable

        private void setUpPermutationTable​(long seed)
        Set up Permutation table for choosing Pseudo-random gradients. Method for choosing one of four random gradients as described in 'Improving Perlin Noise' Generates an array of integers 1-255, twice. In generateNoiseValue we hash the values of x and y to get one of the values in this array, then in getGradient we do x mod 4 to get one of four different gradients.
        Parameters:
        seed - the seed of the random function

      • lerp

        private float lerp​(float t,
                   float a1,
                   float a2)
        Linear interpolation between a1 and a2 by proportion of t,
        e.g for lerp(t= 0.3, a1=0, a2=10) == (1/3)
        Parameters:
        t - the ratio to interpolate by
        a1 - the first value
        a2 - the last value
        Returns:
        The linearly interpolated value

      • ease

        private float ease​(float t)
        Polynomial function 6t^5 - 15t^4 + 10t^3, used to ease our interpolation
        Parameters:
        t - the value to ease
        Returns:
        The eased value

      • generateNoiseValue

        private float generateNoiseValue​(float x,
                                 float y)
        Compute noise value -1 < n < 1 for point P = (x,y)
        Parameters:
        x - the x position
        y - the y position
        Returns:
        The noise at the position

      • noise

        public float noise​(float x,
                   float y)
        This function implements the concept of multi-layered noise. The function 'layers' multiple noise functions on top of each other to allow for small changes. This is the main function to call with the PerlinNoise class
        Parameters:
        x - the x position
        y - the y position
        Returns:
        The noise at the position
